creator: k0te@cox.net
text:
every SSI directive works properly except 'exec'  I have spent hours playing
with the httpd.conf and even rebuilt my server from scratch, following the
directions  from the site exactly to add SSI support without any luck getting
exec to work.

the relevent parts of my httpd.conf as it is now...

AddType text/html .shtml
AddOutputFilter INCLUDES .shtml

<Directory />
    Options FollowSymLinks Indexes Includes
    AllowOverride None
</Directory>

(no other 'Options' are set anywhere in the file)

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Do you have mod_cgi included in your server?  Can you show us an excerpt from the
ssi page and the exact error message that you get?

In general, "include virtual" should always be used in preference to "exec".
see bug #10574, i found the source of the bug
creator: k0te@cox.net
k0te@cox.net
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 10574 ***
